direction.raw_text: As the credits run, we INTERCUT the following two sequences:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through a collection of crudely constructed, surreal, six-foot tall "IDOLS."  Like modern demons. Grotesque.  Disturbing. WE LAP DISSOLVE between details of their twisted anatomies:  headlamp eyes, bright metal claws, broken glass teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two vehicles, one a Volkswagen "bus" decorated with stylized flames, the other a '66 Thunderbird, speeding along a series of eerily empty desert roads, somewhere in a wilderness of sand and heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A violent WIND HOWLS around, but through the sand we-can just make out a large, ominous building:  the HOUSE of William Nix.  Its walls are white-washed and scrawled with GRAFFITI. The "family" of IDOLS surrounds the doorway, guarding it. ON SCREEN, the words:  '"Nevada - Thirteen Years Ago"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're at the front door now, which stands open.  Leaning against the door-frame is a scrawny, wild-eyed YOUTH, about sixteen.  His name is BUTTERFIELD.  He's got a brooding, almost sultry look on his face.  One of his eyes is black, the other milky blue.  He's whittling something with a scalpel. Distantly, the sound of CAR ENGINES.  Butterfield narrows his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Volkswagen "bus" and Thunderbird are approaching the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann...? He turns from the door.  In his haste he drops the WOOD he's whittling.  He's been carving a DEATH'S HEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house no longer serves any domestic function.  It has become the temple and dormitory of Nix's small apocalyptic cult.  As we go through the house with Butterfield we glimpse a little of what life here is like. The rooms are murky, and chaotic.  The walls, PAINTED with scenes of cities and landscapes BURNING, and creatures from some unspeakable nightmare ATTACKING, RAPING, and DEVOURING helpless humanity.  The atmosphere is joyless, and oppressive. The passages become progressively darker as the boy makes his way to the heart of the house.  Only OIL LAMPS, set on the floor, light these claustrophobic corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dozen CULTISTS sit cross-legged on the floor in front of their leader, WILLIAM NIX.  His black hair grows to his shoulders.  His eyes are deep and glittering, his voice seductive.  A terrifying yet charismatic presence. All the Cultists - who are a cross-section of obsessives - wear the same simple T-shirts, painted with the cult's SIGIL. They watch Nix in adoration. As Nix speaks, he juggles a FLAME, passing it from hand to hand with casual ease...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the fire said to me:  Nix, Nix, you're my instrument. From now on, you'll be called the Puritan...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puritan...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will find a few good men and women, and together, together you will cleanse the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Butterfield enters. BUTTERFIELD Master? Nix looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann's here. Nix rises, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll come back to this. Get about your business. As the Cultists disperse, Nix and Butterfield exit into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A place of nightmares. Hanging from the middle of the ceiling is another grotesque SCULPTURE, three times the bulk of a large man, and made of metal, fly-blown animal parts and knotted rope.  It is vaguely cruciform, but its swaying, creaking bulk is not even faintly Christian.  It is a perverse, sickening image, evoking insanity and agony. From the shadows in the corner, we hear a young girl's soft
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush... Nix goes to the GIRL.  She is twelve; beautiful, blonde, and presently in a state of mortal fear.  She sits, bound, in a fetal position, her face soaked with SWEAT and TEARS, her mouth BLOODIED, her cheek BRUISED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said hush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.  Let me go. From the opposite corner the SCREECH of Nix's pet BABOON. Nix goes to it.  The animal is large and lethal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? The Baboon pulls on its chain, staring at the Girl and baring its teeth as it screeches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he's in love. He unshackles the Baboon.  The animal pads toward the Girl, trailing its chain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it away from me. Nix catches hold of its chain.  Holds it back.  The Baboon starts screeching again, scrabbling at the Girl, its NAILS catching her arms and legs, drawing BLOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... please... Nix watches her terror dispassionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyed) Want me to shoot Swann?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like him, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants your magic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.  Go fetch him. Butterfield exits.  Nix advances on the Girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two vehicles come to a halt outside Nix's house. From the Thunderbird steps PHILIP SWANN, a nineteen- year-old with shoulder-length hair and brilliant blue eyes.  He's not conventionally handsome, but he's certainly striking. From the passenger seat steps CASPAR QUAID, a black man, studious and intense.  From the bus emerges MURRAY PIMM, skinny and jittery, and JENNIFER DESIDERIO, a woman with a steely gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say the word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, maybe we should think this over. On Swann, as he brings from his car three very bizarre pieces of METALWORK.  We get only a tantalizing glimpse of them, as he slips them into his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  He's gone too far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he took a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No he won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going to get the chance. Quaid checks a gun, then slips it into his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he gets in our fucking heads he'll drive us crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So stay out here. Swann starts towards the House.  Jennifer is the first to follow, with the other two on her heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butterfield comes to the door, as Swann steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's expecting you. Behind Swann, Quaid and Pimm exchange nervous looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look around.  If you find 'the child, yell.  She's got blonde hair, that's all I know. Butterfield turns away, smiling to himself.  Swann follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quaid looks into a large circular room where FIVE CULTISTS (three men and two women) still sit.  One of the women is breast-feeding a baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Quaid.  I thought you said you weren't coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I changed my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come and join us. She smiles a crazy smile.  Reaches out for Quaid.  A SNAKE appears from around the back of her neck.  Quaid recoils. And now we see that there are snakes everywhere.  In the Cultists' clothes and hair.  Even on the baby.  Quaid turns away.  And - shock! - there's a SNAKE on the door frame, winding around his hand.  He strikes it to the ground, and drives his heel down on its head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do that! The Snake-Handler gets up.  Quaid retreats from the door. Snake-Handler picks up the dead snake and, lifting it above his head, dribbles its BLOOD onto his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer enters a gloomy room.  She goes to a mattress where a BLONDE GIRL lies with her bare back to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be afraid. The Blonde Girl, BARBARA, turns over.  She has a dirty cloth pressed to a wound between her breasts.  It is not the Girl, of course.  She stares up at Jennifer, clearly drugged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not... want to see? She pulls the cloth away.  She has carved the cult SIGIL into her FLESH.  The BLOODY KNIFE lies beside her. Jennifer retreats to the door, and exits back out into -- INT. NIX'S HOUSE - PASSAGEWAY - DAY Pimm is standing against the wall, clutching a CRUCIFIX. He is ashen with terror.  Jennifer snatches the crucifix from his white-knuckled fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to kill us all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did Swann go? Pimm points down the passageway towards Nix's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann wipes sweat from his upper lip, then reaches down to his belt, to check the GUN tucked out of sight at his side. He turns the door handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann steps inside.  Nix's chair has its back to him. The folds of Nix's robe are visible, however.  Swann hears a muffled SOBBING from the far side of the room. On the Girl, now gagged and lying amongst bones and filth. Swann starts towards her, his footsteps barely audible.  As he approaches the chair - the Baboon leaps at him screeching! He reaches for his gun.  The chair topples.  The Baboon, half dressed in Nix's robes, bounds towards Swann. Swann FIRES at it.  The bullet blasts off half its head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Quaid, who draws his GUN as three CULTISTS appear in the passageway that leads to Nix's Sanctum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay the fuck away! (yells) Pimm!  Get over here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP from the twitching Baboon corpse to Swann as he struggles with the Girl's gag.  He has laid his gun on the ground beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to be okay. Out of focus, behind him, the cruciform sculpture swings round.  Nix is hanging on it, like an idol on a grotesque altarpiece. The Girl sees Nix over Swann's shoulder.  Terror crosses her face.  Swann turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you'd come. He reaches down to Swann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got so much power to give you, Swann.  All you have to do is...beg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think I've got it to give?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Suddenly. Nix swoops down on Swann. apparently defying gravity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wrong. He catches hold of Swann with one hand and drives him back against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could eat your fucking soul, Swann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer, reaches the door of the Sanctum.  Butterfield steps from the shadows.  His KNIFE flashes as it strikes Jennifer's hand.  BLOOD SPURTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck! She retreats, staunching her bleeding hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix has Swann trapped against the wall and is working his fingers against Swann's temples.  Working, working, like a psychic surgeon plying against the belly of a patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to know what the world really looks like? Swann struggles, but he can't get free of Nix's hold. And now -- horribly -- Nix's fingers slide beneath the skin of Swann's temples, without a drop of blood being spilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to see flesh with a god's eyes? Swann SCREAMS as Nix's mind-hold seizes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quaid levels his gun at Butterfield, who is guarding the Sanctum door.  Jennifer is at Quaid's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from the door! Butterfield shakes his head.  Quaid FIRES.  The bullet. strikes the wall beside Butterfield's head.  He retreats, growling like a rabid animal.  Quaid kicks the Sanctum door open, and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here he is. Swann stumbles into the middle of the room, the whites of his eyes blood-red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look, Swann!  These are your friends. On Swann, reeling like a drunkard as he looks up at Quaid and Jennifer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to him? SWANN'S P.O.V. of Quaid and Jennifer.  To Swann's eyes, their faces seem to be MORPHING.  Their humanity is MELTING AWAY. What's left is like a jellyfish with black, soulless eyes:  PRIMEVAL MUCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann.  It's okay. Quaid reaches for Swann, who retreats in horror, shaking his head violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch me.  He's got... got into my head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to be like that, Swann? Mud and shit? Swann turns away from Quaid and Jennifer in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Nix, his arms outstretched in welcome.  His face has an aura of pulsing light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here.  Share the power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a GUN, leveled. .We don't see by whom.  The trigger is pulled. The bullet strikes Nix's back and explodes out of his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staring at Nix. SWANN'S P.O.V. of Nix, as the aura of light dies. Just for a moment - a terrible moment - Swann glimpses something else. MORPHING out of Nix's features.  A NIGHTMARE FACE with waves of DARKNESS emanating from the middle of its forehead. Swann covers his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann!  Swann! Nix staggers, letting out an ungodly HOWL, and drops to his knees, clutching the WOUND.  As he falls, he reveals the ashen Girl, who is still holding Swann's smoking GUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me! Swann shakes his head, ridding himself of Nix's mind- control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinon stands guard, his gun pointed on several cultists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: confidence) You can't kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll just rise up again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Nix, doing just that:  rising up.  Right hand clamped to his bloody chest, left hand reaching for Swann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me! Quaid FIRES at him again. Strikes his shoulder.  And again. Strikes his leg.  Nix collapses to the ground,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quickly! They have come prepared for this.  Swann now takes from his jacket the three strange pieces of METALWORK.  There are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in then all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann?  What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Binding you. He clamps one of the pieces over Nix's EYES.  It fits like an eyeless mask.  Nix thrashes and SCREAMS.  Swann lays his hands on the side of the mask, and  LIKE MAGIC -- his touch makes the screws tighten of their own accord, grinding into Nix's flesh and bone with a gut- wrenching SOUND.  BLOOD runs from the screw-holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you, Swann!  Fuck you! Now the second piece, over his MOUTH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sw He's silenced.  The piece screws itself into-his head, like the first.  And now comes the third and final piece:  over the nose and into the ears.  Again, it screws itself into place. Swann has done all he can.  He retreats from Nix's body, as it continues to convulse.  We go from face to ashen face, as each man and woman watches and waits.  Why won't he die? And now, at last  the violence of Nix's death-throes diminishes.  Nix's body bends like a bow, arching off the ground, and with one last, terrible spasm, he dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it finished?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cultists' faces slacken, as though some mental hold Nix had upon them has disappeared.  Then they start to retreat, their confidence and courage gone. Pimm steps into the Sanctum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The five assassins, including the Girl, stand around Nix's body.  Swann has his arm around the Girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We bury him so deep no one will ever find him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .HOUSE - WIDE SHOT - DUSK The wind has died away.  It's eerily calm.  Butterfield dashes towards camera, then halts. HE LOOKS BACK, as Nix's killers load his huge, limp CORPSE into the back of Murray Pimm's bus. ON Butterfield.  He watches, with a feral look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOS ANGELES - MONTAGE - DAY The city looks magical in the spring light, its palms and gleaming towers, its rivers of sun-baked traffic, evoking some fantastical metropolis.  This, for all its smog and congestion, is a city of exoticism and enchantments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the words:  "LOS ANGELES - THIRTEEN YEARS LATER" EXT. STARDUST HOTEL - DAY The facade of this small HOTEL off Hollywood Boulevard needs a lick of paint, and the neon sign is blinking fitfully, but it has a certain charm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large deteriorating mural of Hollywoodland, depicting a host of 50's movie stars, dominates the lobby. At the front desk - with his back to us at present - stands
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  He is having difficulty getting the pretty but vacant BLONDE at the reception desk to comprehend his name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you spell that again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A.M.O.U.R.  D'Amour.  Harry D'Amour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'Amour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that French for something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaching Harry from the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister D'Amour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  It's French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For love, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister D'Amour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's so cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister D'Amour? Harry turns.  He's wearing a washed-out Grateful Dead t- shirt, an Italian cut linen suit, and glasses.  He's handsome, unshaven, 35-ish, with an open easy smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't paid the cab.  He won't give us your bags 'til you pay him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-five bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him he can keep them. The Bellboy looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just kidding. Harry gets out his wallet and hands over four ten-dollar bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got my life in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the suit-case, which is now on the bed.  Harry flings it open.  Inside, mingled with the clothes, a bizarre collection of items, which he tosses out onto the coverlet.  A GUN.  A CRUCIFIX.  A STATUE of Shiva, the Hindu Lord of creation and destruction. ON HARRY, as he heads into the bathroom.  Turns on the shower.  Starts to undress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, his hair still wet from his shower, steps out into the sun.  Squints.  Puts on sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, L.A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a nice evening, Mr. D'Amour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry stands, in a shabby doorway across the street from a classy restaurant.  It's RAINING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a middle-aged, balding man with a very pretty
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opposite him, sitting at a table close to the window. Tapert makes a joke (unheard).  The woman laughs. ON HARRY, chewing on a hamburger, as he speaks into his tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine-eighteen p.m.  Tapert's either got a great sense of humour or he's paying her to laugh. (looks at hamburger in disgust) Jesus. On Tapert, as he rises from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's finished. Tapert exits the restaurant, and crosses the street. Harry tosses his half-eaten hamburger away, and goes to his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry pulls the parking ticket off the windshield, screws it up and gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into tape) Nine twenty-six p.m.  He's off again. He turns the key in the ignition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In neon blue and purple, a sign blazes in a store window.  It reads:  TAROT CARD AND CRYSTAL READINGS - $15 SPECIAL ON TAPERT, as he hurries across the street, and through the door beside the store window. WE PAN OFF the door as Harry's car comes to a halt on the far side of the street. Harry gets out of the car.  Stares at the sign in the window, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Superstitious? He starts across the street.  Suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God! Tapert emerges, his face white with terror.  He stumbles to his car, and he's away.  Harry freezes, caught between the need to follow Tapert and sheer curiosity. He gives in to the latter, and steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An illuminated ARROW points up the stairs.  Harry ascends, past faded PHOTOGRAPHS of Caspar Quaid with famous faces. At the landing, the passageway turns ninety degrees. Harry halts, and takes out his GUN. There's a strange RUMBLING SOUND approaching from round the corner.  Harry chances a look.  There's a short length of passageway, leading to an open door.  From the threshold a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rolls towards Harry, BLOOD- SMEARED.  This is the source of the rumbling.  Harry stops the ball before it falls down the stairs. Dead silence.  After a beat, Harry creeps towards the open door.  He pushes it open.  Inside, chaos.  The fake antique
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is splintered, the ASTRAL CHARTS slashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are two offices.  In the front, a Waiting Room, into which Harry now steps.  Beyond it, through a door that stands narrowly ajar, the Fortune Telling Room. From out of the Fortune Telling Room, a MOAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh. . . Harry crosses the Waiting Room, reaching into his jacket for his gun.  Suddenly, a nightmarish FIGURE leaps from the shadows. His name is RAY MILLER.  He's as crazy as a rabid dog, teeth sharpened, eyes wild.  Nix's SIGIL is tattooed on the middle of his forehead.  He STRIKES the GUN from Harry's hand and goes for his throat. Harry reaches out behind him, picks up a phrenologist's BUST and SMASHES it on Miller's skull. Miller reels back.  Harry makes a dash for the door to the Fortune Telling Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mysterious, candle-lit space.  In the middle of the room, a table.  At it sits Quaid. thirteen years older. He has been tortured close to death.  Several small SCALPELS protrude from his chest and neck.  His life is ebbing away.  On the table in front of him, a fan of TAROT CARDS, BLOOD-SPATTERED. Harry races in through the open door from the Waiting Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck!? Harry picks up the PHONE.  It's dead.  Miller charges at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! Harry SLAMS the door in Miller's face, and locks it. As he does so, the candles FLICKER.  Harry looks up.  A FIGURE looms from the darkness behind Quaid.  He's in his late twenties:  an androgynous, disturbing sight. His long hair is drawn back into a pony-tail.  His mismatched eyes - one black, one milky blue, tell us that he is Butterfield. His hands are BLOODY, and he carries one last SCALPEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch him." Butterfield strokes the wounds on Quaid's cheek.  Quaid sobs in pain. BUTTERFIELD What are you going to do about it? Miller's hand tears at the wood around the lock from the other side.  His fingers appear, scrabbling to tear the lock out.  Harry doesn't move, or Miller will be through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever watched a man die?  If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. And if you're very quick, you can catch it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... Butterfield... I wasn't there.  Ask Pimm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared.  They knew the Puritan was coming home. As this exchange goes on, Miller pulls the lock out of the door and starts to THROW HIMSELF against it from the other side.  It's all Harry can do to keep himself from being pitched across the room.  He looks around for some means of defense.  There's a crack in the drapes to the left of the table.  Behind it a WINDOW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do you.  You've seen the future. Haven't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And are you afraid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Suddenly, Harry steps aside.  The door's flung open. Miller
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in.  Harry catches hold of his arm, and THROWS him against the drape.  The window CRACKS; the drape comes down around Miller.  Amber STREETLIGHT floods in. Butterfield is momentarily distracted.  Harry STRIKES the scalpel from his hands. Miller, meanwhile, is struggling to free himself from the folds of the drapes.  Harry lands a solid KICK to the man's belly.  Miller is THROWN back against the cracked window, which SHATTERS.  Still wrapped in the drape, he FALLS OUT. Harry turns back to arrest Butterfield, but he's already making his escape.  Harry starts after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't leave me. He turns back.  TEARS are pouring down the man's face. Harry goes back to comfort Quaid, as Butterfield escapes down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need an ambulance.
direction.name: direction

Then the head cracks open, and out of the dragon's mouth emerge a dozen scantily dressed DANCERS, male and female.  Swann throws down the spear, and where it strikes the stage his PANTHER appears. direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaos.  PEOPLE running, sobbing, puking; some simply standing watching.  Valentin is already at the body, with the STAGE MANAGER at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get then out of here, for God's sake -- STAGE MANAGER You heard him!  It's not a fucking show! He starts to physically push the crowd back.  Harry grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? Harry uses his grip to gently but efficiently move the STAGE MANAGER out of Dorothea's way.  She goes to Swann's body, which has been removed from the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The audience is clearing now.  But Butterfield is coming towards the stage, with an ambiguous look on his face. Is he enraged?  Or puzzled?  Or both?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Psst! Miller stands at an open door, leading below the stage. Butterfield enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorothea kneels at Swann's side.  A few yards from her, Harry examines the mechanism of the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann... A DOCTOR appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a doctor.  Let me through. The Doctor checks Swann's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... Harry has discovered a CABLE snaking down beside the device. He's suspicious.  He slips round to the back of the mechanism, and climbs down beneath the stage, tracing the cable as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BELOW STAGE - NIGHT It's an eerie, shadowy space, filled with the PROPS that are used in the show, including the DRAGON we saw at the beginning.  From above we hear FOOTSTEPS and VOICES, muted and echoing. The cable ends in bare wires.  Whatever was here has been taken. A NOISE, behind Harry.  He swings round.  Sees a shadowy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ducking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! He gives chase.  Loses the man in the shadows.  Stops and listens for movement. Suddenly, Miller steps out of the shadows with a plank of wood and smashes it into Harry's face! Harry reels back.  Falls to his knees, BLOOD running from his nose.  Miller pulls Harry's GUN out of his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got you, fucker! Harry is facing the dragon's head, dazed.  And now, out of the dragon's mouth, comes Butterfield. BUTTERFIELD Who did this, D'Amour?  Who killed Swann? Harry is barely holding on to consciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did. (a beat) Didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beats me. Butterfield is a foot from Harry now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a clue what you're into, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep shit? Butterfield hits him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you -- Butterfield hits him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  It was... Butterfield comes a little closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... it was... Butterfield leans in.  And Harry grabs him by the balls -- literally -- rising as he does so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aah! Harry THROWS Butterfield aside. Butterfield hits the ground in agony, and Harry swings round to protect himself from Miller, who's leveling Harry's gun. He FIRES once, missing Harry by inches.  Harry catches hold of a ROPE underfoot and pulls it, tripping Miller, who
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: backwards into the mouth of the dragon.  The GUN GOES OFF again, the bullet BLOWING APART the dragon's JAW MECHANISM. Miller starts to sit up, his body splayed between the dragon's steel teeth.  He has Harry in his sights. -- something CREAKS.  He looks up.  The dragon's jaw is closing, FAST.  He starts to scramble to his feet.  Too late! The teeth SLAM CLOSED on his body.  Sudden death. Harry looks round to see Butterfield retreating into the shadows.  Then he's gone.  Harry looks down at Miller's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which is pooling around his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLICE STATION - EDDISON'S OFFICE - NIGHT Harry sits at Eddison's desk, looking exhausted and bruised. Eddison has just finished taking his statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this Butterfield guy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another fucking magician. Jesus. Harry looks past Eddison and sees an ashen, tearful Dorothea being taken into another office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you finished with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For now.  Are you planning to go back to New York?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Not yet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorothea sits alone, staring at the wall.  Harry enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are they treating you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard what happened.  It looks like somebody murdered him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I got into this too late. But if you want me to stick around, maybe dig where the cops don't look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know where you'd start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... how about some of the other illusionists?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't tell you anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can be very persuasive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I think you probably can. (another beat) We'd need to talk about your fee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the fee.  If I find Butterfield, maybe we'll talk about money.  If I don't... (he shrugs) ...my gamble.  Either way... I get to spend some time... here. The way he says this, it's plain "here" doesn't mean L.A., it means near -Dorothea.  And by the tiny smile on her face, it's also plain she knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Noon.  Bright sun.  Busy street.  Harry, now wearing a bandage on his cut face, enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wonderland for illusionists.  Books, props, masks, tricks, etc.  Two or three CUSTOMERS browse.  Harry glances at them all, then targets a MAN in late middle age, who is browsing through books, one-handed.  His other hand constantly manipulates a card, concealing and revealing it in a dozen ways.  He doesn't even look at his hand.  His name is WALTER WILDER. Harry stands beside him.  Scans the shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you learn that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At birth.  I don't know you -- HARRY Harry D'Amour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all the kids coming up. Got to stay ahead of the game. But I don't know you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in from New York.  I came to see Swann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a tragedy.  It was just a matter of time, of course, but it's not good for the business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he taking a lot of risks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know the half of it. I'm Walter Wilder, by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the Walter Wilder? Walter beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one and only. He hands Harry a card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to try? Harry tries to emulate Wilder's card manipulation through the rest of this conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Vinovich?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  Vivovich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knew Swann way back.  He says there were a lot of drugs, a lot of crazy shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to... you know... hang with some of you guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are pretty cagey.  Who do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For an introduction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... nobody. Wilder takes a moment to assess Harry, who is attempting to manipulate the card he's been given with charming ineptitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The castle is faux, of course, but it has a Gothic charm. Harry and Walter wander towards the front door.  Harry is knotting a newly-bought tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only wear ties for funerals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't get in without one. It's like a gentlemen's club for illusionists.  Except most of us aren't gentlemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interior is murky and atmospheric, the walls covered with illusionists' posters. Walter leads the way through the long corridors, past rooms where illusionists are performing close-up magic for audiences of well-heeled patrons.  Walter nods and waves to half a dozen people on their way through the house, up the stairs and towards the bar. HARRY Are they all in the business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a business. Harry. It's a vocation. Wilder points to a locked door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what they call the Repository.  Every magic secret known to man's locked up in that room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  There's only three keys. Vinovich has got one, of course. (beat) He's a little crazy, by the way. And he's a mean drunk. Otherwise, he's a real charmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAGIC CASTLE - BAR - NIGHT Later.  A drunken VINOVICH is holding court.  He's in his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s:  a flamboyant and loquacious man with a heavy (and fake) middle-European accent.  At the table - besides Harry and Walter - are:  Vinovich's starlet/nymphet girlfriend
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; an Asian-American illusionist called BILLY WHO; and two of Vinovich's adoring courtiers, an overblown, overdressed female illusionist - DEBRA DEVINE - and a thin, waspish fellow in a spangly suit:  the AMAZING QUENTIN. In the conversation that follows we go back to Harry repeatedly as he studies this extraordinary group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's more than entertainment. We're opening people's heads up.  Putting miracles back into their boring little lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they're fake miracles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Houdini believed he had spirit guides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we walk a narrow path, between... between...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heaven and Hell? Vinovich stares hard at Harry, trying to figure out whether he's being sarcastic or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trickery and divinity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you saying that sometimes the miracles are real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'm saying they were always fake.  The saints, the messiahs, they were just illusionists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So could you walk on water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could reproduce any miracle that's ever been performed, with a little preparation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Swann's miracles? The smug smile on Vinovich's face dies.  Furtive glances are exchanged around the table.  Only Billy Who makes a tiny smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They weren't worth a damn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard he was the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he was so good why's he so dead? Vinovich begins to look suspicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me.  No?  I thought you'd maybe have a theory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I've got plenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to hear them. Vinovich rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying another word. (to Wilder) You damn fool.  He's a journalist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me about Swann.  Or are you too scared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a freak.  Everything he did was tainted. Harry rises.  Looks straight at Vinovich, unintimidated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evil.  He was evil. (to Laura) Come on. She rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say nothing to this man if you wish to keep my company. He stalks away.  Harry calls after him, across a now- silenced bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great accent, by the way.  Is it Brooklyn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry heads to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry! Harry turns.  Billy approaches, glancing behind him to see that he's not being watched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta be careful.  If Vinovich sees me talking to you.  He's an asshole, but he's a powerful asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They go together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard a name.  Someone they talk about in whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like in nothing.  Nobody.  Nix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think maybe he taught Swann. (hands Harry a card) This is me.  See ya around. Billy hurries away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry lies on his bed, dozing.  The CAMERA CREEPS IN on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I want somebody who can find out what Philip saw in those damn cards... Harry frowns in his semi-doze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - QUAID'S ROOM BUTTERFIELD Ever watched a man die? The image darkens, and fades up a beat later on Quaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... I wasn't there... Ask Pimm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry is still asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - QUAID'S ROOM QUAID I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home... A long silence. SUDDENLY, a telephone RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits up, shocked awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! He picks up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is D'Amour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sits up on her bed, dressed in a silk robe, and nothing else, drinking a SCOTCH, talking on the phone. The primary source of illumination is the massive T.V. set in the wall opposite the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry... I know it's late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There should be a subtle eroticism pervading this exchange. Both of them on beds, in different bedrooms. Each aroused by the other's voice, and frustrated not to be able to see and touch them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. As he speaks, Harry scrawls Jennifer Desiderio on the title page of the Gideon's Bible beside the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did it go today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went up to the Magic Castle. You were right.  He didn't have a lot of fans up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valentin, on the kitchen PHONE, is listening in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were jealous of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?  Because he had you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : HARRY - DOROTHEA - VALENTIN DOROTHEA He... didn't have me..  I told you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't marry him for love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a little uncomfortable now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you marry him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my business. Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just curious. (a beat) Back to business.  Ever heard of a man called Nix? (silence) Dorothea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... I'm here.  And no.  I don't know the name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Jennifer Desiderio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't ring a bell.  I have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  I'll keep digging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  You do that. She puts down the phone, and swallows a mouthful of scotch. She's shaking.  She gets up.  Paces the room. Then she picks up the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the pad beside the bed, Jennifer's name, surrounded by Harry's doodles.  The phone RINGS. CUT WIDE:  The room is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tarot Card and Crystal Readings sign is dark now. Harry heads up the stairs, past the PHOTOGRAPHS, to the door of Quaid's Waiting Room. It has been locked and taped by the police.  Harry has come prepared.  He takes out a small crowbar and levers off the locks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry enters, FLASHLIGHT on.  He crosses the Waiting Room and enters the Fortune-Telling Room where Quaid died.  On the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a remote, eerie presence -- we hear Quaid's SOBS, Miller's SHOUTS, and, as Harry's flashlight illuminates the blood-spattered table:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. Harry is spooked.  He starts to search the room, opening cabinets and drawers.  Quaid's hordes of mystical bric-a-brac are stashed everywhere.  Boxes of crystals, religious statues, elaborate cards, incense, etc. He pulls open a drawer, and notices that a rosary is wedged in a niche at the base of the drawer.  He pulls the drawer out, empties its contents on the table, and examines it. Using the crowbar, he forces the drawer apart.  It has a false bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... In the secret compartment, some papers and an address book. He flicks to "D."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Desiderio... There it is.  Jennifer Desiderio, and an address.  He pockets the book.  Then, sensing a presence behind him, he pulls out his gun and whirls around, his flashlight beam revealing -- -- Valentin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for you.  I tried the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a detective, with no clues. Where else are you going to look? I'm going to keep this brief. (he takes out an envelope) Here's thirty thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ticket home,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't hire me.  She did. If she wants me off the job, I want to hear it from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't want to see you. She's had enough pain.  Enough churning over the past.  She wants it all left alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left alone?  Somebody's been murdered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  It's regrettable
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck regrettable!  I want to know why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?  You need to stay busy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like to know why things happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why people die? (shakes his head) Give it up, D'Amour.  Go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Harry crosses to the door, brushing past Valentin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try and see her, D'Amour. Just leave her alone.  Let her heal. He glances back at Valentin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lock up, will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUKE'S SANITORIUM, PASADENA - DAY ON THE ADDRESS BOOK, in Harry's hands. Harry looks up - with some surprise - not at a house but at a building, the sign on which reads, "St. Luke's Sanitorium".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUKE'S SANITORIUM - DAY The place is bland and functional throughout, the walls decorated with sun-faded reproductions of great paintings. Nothing disturbing.  Harry is talking to D.A. TOFFLER - black, fortyish, softly spoken - and a Nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer's only ever had one visitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Quaid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  And he's dead, isn't he?  I saw it on the news. Jennifer doesn't know.  And frankly, this isn't the best tine for her to be told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUKE'S SANITORIUM - CORRIDORS AND WARD - DAY Toffler excorts Harry through -the place.  There are distressing scenes on every side.  Nothing melodramatic no screaming, no fits.  Just a subtle, pervasive air of despair. Blank, empty FACES in blank, empty rooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer's been with us four years. She was coming on nicely. But just the last month or so, she's worse than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has no real grip on reality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes.  We have to agree what's real and what's not. That's what holds us together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what does Jennifer think's real? They've come to french windows, which are wide open. Sitting outside in the sun is Jennifer, with her back to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer thinks the Devil's coming for her. (louder) Jennifer? Jennifer turns.  She looks terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUKE'S SANITORIUM - GROUNDS - CITY STREET - DAY Harry and Jennifer walk amongst the flower-beds, with the Nurse keeping a watch from a discreet distance. Throughout the scene we HEAR the SOUND of earth being dug, which steadily gets louder as they walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have we met before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only I forget.  They give me pills, you know, to keep me... even... and... I forget things,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you didn't forget me.  I just came because I wanted to know if you knew a man called Butterfield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe... I... don't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Philip Swann?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew Swann. (sudden vehemence) He's a fucking liar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: saunters past, carrying pipes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he knew how to protect us. But he didn't know anything.  He made us think it was over and done with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to think about it. If I think about it he'll hear me. He'll find me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swann? Ahead now, the site where the workmen are digging a hole, laying pipes.  The CAMERA doesn't focus on this action, but we're aware of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you.  I don't -- She stops.  Looks ahead of her.  Her face is suddenly ashen and clammy.  Harry follows her gaze to: The hole.  Somebody is in it, digging.  Earth emerges in shovelfuls, piling up beside the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God no!  Oh God no! She backs away from the hole.  The Nurse grabs hold of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down! She delivers the Nurse a backhand SWIPE.  The Nurse is flung back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going to get me! She races down towards the street.  Harry goes after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not!  He's not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's not? He catches up with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix! Nix!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he the Puritan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he's dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  He's coming back.  He's digging his way out! The Nurse appears behind Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take care of her now. Jennifer struggles in Harry's grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of her, Mr. D'Amour! The Nurse breaks Harry's hold on Jennifer, who slips away instantly, racing towards the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer! She scrambles up over a wall, and flings herself from the top.  There's a SCREECH of brakes, then the smashing of metalwork and glass.  Harry gets to the wall before the Nurse.  Hoists himself up onto it.  Looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer is dead in the middle of the street, beneath the wheels of a car.  The DRIVER is out, and yelling incoherently. HARRY Jesus. He slips back down the wall, and leans against it. He looks towards the hole.  The Workman has stopped digging. His mud-encrusted hands emerge, and for a moment, before his head appears, the image is eerily like somebody climbing from a grave.  Harry closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun is setting, the city giving way to night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry's on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to speak to Dorothea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid she's not in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When will she be in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valentin on the phone in the study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it? Valentin puts the phone down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crank call.  I'll get the number changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No word from D'Amour? Valentin shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's better he's gone.  He would have done more harm than good.
direction.name: direction

It looks up, its face that of a psychotic:  burning eyes, manic smile. It tears open its straight-jacket and reaches for Billy, who backs away.

It comes at Harry.  Harry FIRES at it, but it comes at him faster still, rising to burn Harry's leg.  He retreats, the FIRE racing after him. He makes for a door, and flings it open.  He's in -- INT. So are several faces we recognize: Vinovich, Wilder, Billy Who, Swann's Stage Manager, his Dancers, his Technicians.  There are also several members of the PRESS, and thirty or fourty other Mourners, some of whom, to judge by their dress and manner, are also illusionists. Harry stands some distance from the crowd, watching (hidden) from the doorway of a mausoleum.  His eyes are on Dorothea as she goes amongst the Mourners, receiving unheard words of condolesence.

direction.raw_text: .A. STREET - SEMI-DERELICT BUILDING - DAY A bad neighborhood, to judge by the state of the streets. Harry gets out of his car and crosses to a gate, topped with barbed wire.  He peers through the bars. Harry's P.O.V. of the STRANGER from the funeral disappearing into the building.  He glances back towards the street.  We get a glimpse of a bearded face beneath the brim of his hat. Harry slides out of sight.  Waits until the Stranger has gone inside.  Then he's up, over the gate, braving the barbed wire.

direction.raw_text: It's been a hospital.  Now the echoing corridors and wards are deserted, littered with reminders of old suffering. Rotting mattresses; spilled boxes of surgical supplies. Harry explores this tiled labyrinth, looking for some sign of the Stranger. He enters a shadowy room.  Birds fly UP into his face! As he retreats, another SOUND, a little distance from him. GUN in hand, he heads towards it, and steps into
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar! Nix makes a gesture, and Swann is flung against the wall, pinned there like a fly, legs off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will!  You!  Never!  Learn!? With each word, Nix almost casually throws a gesture in Swann's direction, and though there is six feet between them, they have the force of terrible blows.  One to the ribs. They CRACK.  One to the face.  It BLEEDS.  One to the legs, one to the arms.  They all BREAK.  Then Nix turns towards Dorothea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's just flesh, Swannnie-boy. I'll show you! He moves towards Dorothea.  Swann falls to the ground, broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fight between Butterfield and Harry continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry!  Stop him! Harry looks up.  Sees Dorothea retreating from the door, and running off into the darkness. Butterfield comes at Harry again.  Harry's got no more time for this creep.  He delivers Butterfield a backhand swipe, and Butterfield lands face down in the glass.  We don't see the impact.  HEARING it's enough. Harry looks down at the body.  Then -- NIX (V.O.) Where is she? Harry turns. Nix is on him like a luoaernaut. treading on Butterfield's body as he comes at Harry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did she go? Nix GRABS hold of Harry's head with one hand and PRESSES the fingers of -the other hand against Harry's TEMPLES. He struggles to get free, but Nix is simply too powerful. Nix's fingers slowly SLIDE BENEATH the skin of Harry's temples.  As before, there's no blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got Swann's disease. You think a little courage, a little love, and it'll all be all right. Wrong! His fingers slide all the way in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! Harry wrests himself free of Nix, and stumbles away. His eyes are BLOOD-RED.  Nix is a few yards behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me where she is... and I'll make it go away... Harry is reeling around in the grip of a nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The apocalyptic images on the walls seem to move!  A face
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  FIRE blossoms! ON HARRY, verging on insanity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God... oh God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry sees a WOMAN, wrapped in the sickly-sensual embrace of some glistening, barely visible OBSCENITY.  We can't see her face.  Only her mouth is visible in the coils of her devourer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he approaches the wall, on which this woman is painted. Reaching out for the image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Woman reaches for Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he touches the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorothea! He starts to SCRATCH out the plaster on which the image is painted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorothea!  Dorothea!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darkness swallows the image of the woman.  She is still screaming when she disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dragging his broken body to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: literally beating his head against the wall!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  No!  No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry... Harry stops.  Dare he believe this is truly her voice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not real, Harry- Harry turns around.  Dorothea is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a moment, he sees Dorothea as she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: relief flooding his face.  Then -- HARRY'S P.O.V. -- the image MORPHS.  Dorothea's beauty is replaced by primeval muck. ON HARRY, appalled.  Dorothea grabs hold of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry.  Listen to me. Whatever's good between us, believe it. Harry's face is deathly white, and pouring SWEAT.  He's fighting the delirium.  Or doing his best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Nix steps from the shadows of the doorway behind Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are, child. Harry starts to look round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... have... to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, child.  I want Swann to see you die. Harry turns and looks at Nix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix's face darkens as it MORPHS.  And the flesh in the middle of his brow UNFOLDS, revealing a dark, pulsating THIRD EYE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who has gone to the door of the Meditation Room and now slips inside. ON HARRY, staring up at Nix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: re-emerging from the Meditation Room.  In her hand, Harry's GUN.  Harry looks round at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There... there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he looks up at Dorothea. ON DOROTHEA, as she raises the GUN.  She FIRES. The bullet STRIKES Nix's FOREHEAD.  He sinks to his knees,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pouring down his face from the hole where his third EYE used to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Nix's mind-hold falters.  He leans against the wall, shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay.  I'm okay. Harry opens his eyes.  Looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last of the MORPHING fades.  He sees Dorothea as she actually is.  Dorothea goes down to comfort him, and they embrace. Suddenly, a ROAR from Nix.  They look towards him -- -- it isn't over. One last, terrifying transformation is overtaking Nix as he kneels in the GLASS.  His sallow flesh is running in STREAMS up his body towards the DARK HOLE in the middle of his forehead -- NIX One... last... illusion...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his humanity is disappearing, vanishing into the vortex of the bullet wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God. Harry and Dorothea start to get up... Nix is no longer human.  He is a shape of gleaming DARKNESS, stripped of features.  He opens his mouth, the only visible element on his body is his toothed maw, which looses an utterly inhuman SHRIEK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... D'Amour... Harry glances through the door into the Meditation Room. Swann is on the threshold. Nix RISES now.  He is a terrifying spectacle, his bulk somehow more intimidating than ever in this simplified form. He comes at Dorothea, who has no choice but to back away into the Meditation Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pit still yawns in the middle of the floor. Dorothea is backed towards it by Nix. When Nix SPEAKS, his voice is not remotely human.  It is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the purest of the pure.  I am the darkest of the dark... Harry is at the door now, starting towards Nix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry.  You can't kill him. Harry crouches beside Swann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did something with the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  She's a couple of yards from the pit now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm beyond Heaven.  I'm beyond Hell. Suddenly, Harry lunges at Nix, grabbing hold of his legs. Nix topples.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who puts his hands on the ground.  Closes his eyes. A wave of LIQUIFICATION runs through the ground from Swann's broken fingers -- -- the Cultists' bodies MOVE in the softening ground, like corpses in surf, and ROLL towards the pit, their dead faces resurfacing -- Barbara's body floats past Nix, and disappears over the edge of the pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here! The ground is very liquid now, and the corpses are lodging around Nix as they're all carried towards the pit.  So's Harry, of course. Nix tries to get up, but he's too late.  The corpses weigh him down, the ground is too fluid for him to get a proper hold, and Harry still clings to his legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  No!  No! He's at the edge of the pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry! Harry looks round.  Dorothea's behind him, risking the flowing ground to offer him a hand. Nix starts to fall into the pit.  At the last minute, he reaches for Harry, as -- -- Harry is pulled out of reach bv Dorothea. Together they stumble to THE DOOR, where Swann still lies. They look back to see NIX, as he goes over the edge of the pit and FALLS SCREAMING. At the door, Dorothea lifts up Swann's head.  He's dead. She closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we are about to witness is the longest fall-to-his- death by any villain in the history of cinema... Nix is falling through rock.  Still SCREAMING.  He CRASHES against a layer of stone, which his body smashes to smithereens.  And as he falls -- INT. NIX'S HOUSE - PASSAGEWAY - NIGHT DOROTHEA Is it finished?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. No it's not.  Nix keeps falling, breaking through another layer of rock as he descends deeper and deeper into the earth. And now... there's a hint of FIERY LIGHT below.  He's approaching MAGMA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... She puts her arms around him.  Kisses him, sobbing with relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nix hits a layer of molten rock, and, SCREAMING, he disappears.  A BURST of dark, roiling ENERGY erupts from the spot where he sank, and starts up the pit -- INT. NIX'S HOUSE - MEDITATION ROOM - NIGHT The room TREMBLES.  There's a ROAR in the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck? DOROTHEA Harry-?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out!  Out! They race for the front door -- INT. THE PIT -- the wave of ENERGY, like a howling, dark WIND, ascends at a breath-taking rate
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry and Dorothea race for the open air, as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ENERGY ERUPTS from the pit.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ON THE RIM OF THE SUN,

direction.raw_text: Harry and Dorothea stumble out, into the night -- INT. NIX'S HOUSE - VARIOUS - NIGHT The ENERGY howls from room to room, ERODING the images off the walls, BLOWING out the doors, DESTROYING all the resurrection equipment in the Sanctum -- EXT. NIX'S HOUSE - DESERT - DAWN Harry and Dorothea stumble to the car.  They look back at the house, as the cacophony of destruction dies down. ON THE RIM OF THE SUN, as it peeps over the desert horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SUNLIGHT creeps through the rooms as the DUST settles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hole in the floor CLOSES UP, and is SEALED... SILENCE reigns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry and Dorothea get into the car.  Harry glances back at the house.  Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the FRONT DOOR, virtually destroyed by tine.
direction.name: direction
